titleStmt.title: The Rota, or, News from the common-wealths-mens club written by Henry Stubb.
titleStmt.author: Stubbe, Henry, 1632-1676.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A61895 of text R26268 in the English Short Title Catalog (Wing S6064A). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The Rota, or, News from the common-wealths-mens club written by Henry Stubb.
titleStmt.author: Stubbe, Henry, 1632-1676.

notesStmt.note: A satire in verse ridiculing members of the Rota and the theories set forth in James Harrington's "The Rota, or, A model of a free-state or equall common-wealth."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.

keywords.term: Harrington, James, 1611-1677. -- Rota, or, A model of a free-state or equall common-wealth.

ep:epHeader.ep:title: The Rota or, news from the Common-wealths-mens club, written by Mr. Henry Stubb; 'tis better then a syllybub.
ep:epHeader.ep:author: Stubbe, Henry
